title: 107_hr344
content: The Act titled "Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001" eliminates the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits under the Social Security Act. The Act includes amendments to section 223(a)(2) and eliminates a defined term in section 223(c)(2) of the Act. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits under the Social Security Act. Section 223(c)(2) is repealed, and amendments are made to section 223(c)(1) and section 202(e)(1)(F) regarding Widow's Insurance Benefits Based on Disability. The Widow's and Widower's Insurance Benefits Based on Disability are amended under the Social Security Act. The defined term in Section 202(e) is eliminated, and adjustments are made to ensure eligibility for disability insurance benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate defined terms and make adjustments to ensure eligibility for disability insurance benefits for widowers. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate waiting periods for disability and Medicare disability benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability and Medicare disability benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements under Section 226(b). The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability and Medicare disability benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements. This includes adjustments to railroad retirement beneficiary qualifications and Medicare coverage descriptions. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability and Medicare disability benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements for Medicare and railroad retirement beneficiaries. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability and Medicare disability benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements for Medicare and railroad retirement beneficiaries. Effective dates are specified in Section 5. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability and Medicare disability benefits, with specific effective dates outlined. The amendments apply to benefits under section 223 and section 202 of the Act, based on disability, for months after the third month following enactment. The amendments to the Social Security Act remove waiting periods for disability and Medicare disability benefits, with specific effective dates outlined for different sections of the Act. The changes apply to benefits for months after specific timeframes following the enactment of the Act.
